definitions.definition: A rope , cable etc. that holds something in place whilst allowing some movement .
The limit of one's abilities , resources , patience , etc.
examples: Since his hours have increased, I feel that he is at the end of his tether .

definitions.definition: An attachment to a place, time, entity or person.
examples: Despite moving, he maintained a strong tether to his culture back home.

definitions.definition: A strong rope or line that connects a sailor's safety harness to the boat's jackstay .

main_definition: A rope , cable etc. that holds something in place whilst allowing some movement .
secondary_definitions: ( figurative ) The limit of one's abilities , resources , patience , etc.
( figurative ) An attachment to a place, time, entity or person.
( nautical , sailing ) A strong rope or line that connects a sailor's safety harness to the boat's jackstay .
